dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP: A slender woman's hand writes on a chalkboard, in teacherly cursive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK to REVEAL STARLA GRANT, a stunningly beautif Southern woman in her twenties, as she finishes writing out, "SURVIVAL OF THE FITTEST"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla glances at the classroom of high school students. She is a demure woman, somewhat awkward in her speaking, but she has the rapt attention of all the boys in the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Darwin said 'fittest,' he didn't necessarily mean the strongest or the most intelligent, or any one trait -- he merely meant those organisms most well-suited to their environment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys in the class look her up and down as she speaks. KYLIE STRUTEMYER, a pretty student, notices a BOY beside her drawing Starla, only without her clothes. She hits him. He CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We humans think we're more fit, more evolved, because we're smarter. But we're neophytes. We've been around two million years, give or take. The cockroach has been here for 350 million. You tell me who's the more successful species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOY raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's all this go with how the Bible says there ain't no dinosaurs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the kids LAUGH at the boy.   Starla pauses, about to answer, when the BELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll tackle that tomorrow... Everyone bring your boxing gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celebratory banners are strung over this street, includin one that reads: "DEER SEASON STARTS TODAY!" We're in the center of Wheelsy, South Carolina, a moderately depressed small town. Today's a big day, as HUNTERS from far and near crowd the streets in their massive pickups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN spill in and out of a gun store buying loads of ammunition. OLD HUNTERS with faces like prunes stand outside Angell's Tavern getting drunk. A MAN WITH FEW TEETH has a dead deer strung out across the back of his truck, skinning the carcass, its innards spilling loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK, an older, uptight man in fancy clothes, is driving through town in his big old Cadillac. He comes upon a hunter's truck, double-parked, jamming up traffic. Jack jams on his HORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of the way, cocksucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to see a MOTHER and her two CHILDREN on the sidewalk, listening and staring in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mornin', Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles, a bit embarrassed. Jack notices a group of HUNTERS on the sidewalk, looking and pointing at somethin up in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see a small meteor plummeting toward earth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students file out of the open door for the day. Kylie, Starla's pretty student, is among them. She and her FRIEN are looking up at the falling meteor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prolly go find it later, sell it on eBay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RANCHER with a cleft palate turns his head to see the meteor, much closer to him. It's rushing down toward the treetops of a nearby forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A framed wedding photograph of a very young Starla and a large man is sitting on a desk. The photo TREMBLES LIGHTLY, with the impact of the meteor hitting the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANT GRANT, a large, indelicate man in his mid forties, notices the photos on his desk moving. He looks up from his desk and out his door, where there's a GLASS WORKSHOP Two WORKERS are carrying a large pane of glass, looking relieved they didn't drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a tremor, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant goes back to filling out the tags of file folders with a Sharpie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four cops -- BILL PARDY, the town's young,   relaxed, and handsome Chief of Police, WALLY, an older,   toad-like co TREVOR, a younger, somewhat goofy cop, and   MARGARET, a mannish cop -- are standing stock-still in   the station parking lot. They CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did ya' feel that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four cops start to remove their holsters and so forth finished for the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always get afraid when that happens, 'cause what if the ground cracks open and you fall inside? It's so hot in there you get all burnt to nothin' like that -- (snaps) Happened to my uncle Barry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally and Bill LAUGH at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that story, Trevor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My aunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle Barry left her for a stripper up in Winnsboro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks shocked, sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHELBY, a slightly dim dispatcher, on his headset at the police operator's unit, swirls toward them, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief! We got a 'mergency over at the diner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four cops move in.   There's a COMMOTION.   Most of t patrons are standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back there, Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress nods back through the service window, into the kitchen, where a large DOE is hopping around. A DISHWASHER stands on the counter, YELPING with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Wally, Trevor, Margaret, and the Waitress enter. The doe skips around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slipped in, was eating trash. We seen it on TV, how they kill ya'--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we thought we best call in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill spots the open rear door, and tries to herd the deer toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now, honey, door's this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open season. Let's shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just scared, Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, Bill likes to take a female through the back door any chance he gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally and Margaret LAUGH. Trevor snatches a dish-towel and rushes the doe, using it like a cape. The scared doe leaps away from him, jumping onto the kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't a bull, Trevor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animal kicks off a pot, which hits Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn bambi-rat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the doe jumps to the floor, she gets her hoof wrapped in a telephone cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cord is plugged into the wall, trapping the doe in place. Wally, Margaret, and Trevor attempt to dive for the cord, but can't avoid the doe's crazy, flying hooves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other cops step away.   Bill steps slowly toward the doe, speaking calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, sweetheart.   Nobody's gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doe looks at him, settling a bit.   His voice seems t be soothing her. Bill gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Just gonna pull this cord out. It's gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops and restaurant folk look on in awe as the doe, breathing heavily, becomes still. Bill scoops close past her, and yanks the telephone cord out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill smiles. Then the doe runs forward, almost knocking Bill over, and streaks out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Wally, Margaret, and Trevor move up to the doorway and watch the deer skitter off into the woods beyond, dragging the telephone, tied to her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, she took a phone. Now them forest critters are gonna be calling us all hours of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone LAUGHS.   Wally pretends to be on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief of police there? This a squirrel. Bring me a bag of peanuts, motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone LAUGHS some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant locks his office for the day.   His SECRETARY sees him going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night, Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya', Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant walks across the workshop toward the door. He sees a crowd of WORKERS lounging around a glass-cutting table, LAUGHING at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them nod at Grant, and he nods back.   But he's completely outside their circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sizable two-story suburban home.    All the lights are off but one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I get home today, phone's ringing. It's Hank Wilcox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla and Grant eat dinner in this well-decorated room. As Grant chatters, Starla occasionally smiles politely at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callin' for you. What the hell? I said, 'Hank, that's a little bit outta line don't'cha think, a single man callin' someone's wife?' At night, nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla is quiet, almost afraid:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's teaching environmental science, Grant. Probably wants to borrow my lesson plans from last semester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that's what he wants to borrow, this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a work thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work thing hell, Starla. He just wants to get in your pussy. Him and most these other ones around here. That's where their minds is at, them sick fucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes a big bite of food, stuffing his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, sugarplum, you're lucky you got me. You're too damn trusting. Without me to protect you, you'd get kilt one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stares at herself in the mirror as she brushes her hair. She uses long, slow strokes, as if stalling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugarplum, you coming into bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns toward the door.       She doesn't say anyth for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sets her brush down on the counter. She arranges it neatly beside the others. And walks into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant turns off the TV as Starla gets into bed with him. It's almost completely dark in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant crawls on top of Starla. He kisses her and grabs her in a way not meant to be rough, but is utterly withou grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After doing this for a few moments, Starla starts to push him off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, no -- I'm sorry, I'm just -- I'm not in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is on top of her, breathing a little too heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby, it's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   I don't just have some switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through Starla's nightgown, Grant pretends to flick one of her nipples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's disrespectful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, peeved, gets off of her. He sits on the edge of the bed for a moment, in silence. Starla looks afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you in the mood, exactly? Seems to me that mood's as rare as winnin' the Goddamn lotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grabs his slacks off the valet and starts putting them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just some big clown to you, ain't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true -- Where are you-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sits at the bar, knocking back a shot of tequila. He's getting drunk. He taps his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me again there, killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARKEEP fills his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Grant, how's it you come to have the same last name as first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents thought it sounded pleasant, I s'pose. Joke on me, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant notices a woman with a lot of makeup -- BRENDA GUTIERREZ -- staring at him from across the bar, smoking a cigarette. Grant stares at her, trying to figure out who she is. She slides off her stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sashays toward him. She props herself on the stool beside him, leans drunkenly in toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan Halesy' little sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   Brenda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you were --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant holds his hand only so high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was! And I'll tell you somethin', Grant Grant. I's in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister Megan, she's a big fat cow. Was then, even more so now. I'd be thinking, what'd you see in her ain't in me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, girl, you couldn't'a been eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I was game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She LAUGHS. So does Grant. He stares at her, contemplating sinful things. He nods at her wedding ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the lucky fella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck lucky. Never marry a damn half-Mexican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already ain't.     Married a gal named --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla Covington. Don't be ignorant. Everyone knows that. Fucking prom queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant finishes his drink, and gets up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant speaks more loudly than need be:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, she gets real worried 'bout me I stay out too late. Loves me too much, that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances around to see if people have heard, and stumbl out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sits on a boulder beside a creek, looking miserable downing a six pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws an empty can into the creek, when he glances down and sees particles flowing down the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slides off the boulder. He kneels and examines the particles. They shimmer in the moonbeams coming down between the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant peers up the creek from where the particles are coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a gap on the edge of the creek, where water splashes and is diverted in streamlets down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the spot, and comes upon a small crater on the side of the creek. The meteorite is inside the crater but it's cracked into pieces. The rock seems almost organic, like a shell. The shimmery specks are part of the shell itself, flecking off into the creek and rushing downstream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant crouches. He touches the meteorite, and feels some sort of goo inside it. It's sticky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a strip of the same slime leading out of the crater itself and into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, curiously, slowly, follows the slimy trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to a flurry of colorful wild flowers. Something is rustling the flowers ever so slightly. He moves in closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gelatinous yellow organism slithers sluggishly between the flowers. The organism is a mound a few inches high, gross and veiny, yet as colorful as the flowers around it. A small cavity on the apex of the organism constricts and expands lightly. I guess it's not worth keeping secre that this thing looks a tad like a bright yellow vagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is a little freaked-out by this thing, even frightened. He looks around for someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, anybody 'round here?   'Lo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers. Grant looks down at the organism, unsure. He picks up a tree branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant softly prods the organism with the pointy end of the branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does it again.   The thing pulses a little, and surges toward Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand pokes it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, thin quill -- a SPORE -- emerges from the cavity in the center of the organism. The spore is quivering and, as it trembles upward, little bulbed spurs pop up as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slowly bends down to look at it when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SPORE suddenly SHOOTS OUT.   It strikes Grant in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!   Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant yanks up his shirt, looking at a wound on his abdomen. He watches as the spore quivers and disappears inside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clutches his stomach, SCREAMS in agony. He falls back into the colorful flowers. His body convulses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the insides of Grant's body, as if sliced in half. We ZOOM IN on the little spore, which is jittering up through his body, and into his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spore keys into the base of Grant's cerebellum, and his entire brain crackles with a WHITE ELECTRICAL ENERGY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant freezes in place, his fingers contorted up in front of him, silent. He's utterly still, a wax corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hippie CAMPING COUPLE run into the area, looking for the source of the screams. The man looks down at the frozen Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camper crouches down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man. You all right?... Dude?... Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camper turns from Grant to his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's d --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant GASPS suddenly, sitting up and grabbing the man, like a drowning man popping up above water. The Camper YELPS and jumps back. Grant sweats and heaves, trying to speak, but hardly can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taking... my... brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant's eyes glaze over, and he eases off. He heaves there, momentarily confused. His eyes dart around, as if seeing his surroundings for the first time. Grant stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks down curiously at the camper. Then he turns and stumbles away from them, out of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might of been a stroke, buddy. You better take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant drives down the road in his luxury pickup truck, sweating and blinking rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant steps out of the truck in his driveway, when he hears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey ya', Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant swings his head toward his NEIGHBOR, who is taking a happy BEAGLE for a morning walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were ya', night-fishing again? You catch anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I caught a little somethin', yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant walks inside his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks around the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant creeps into the bedroom, looking around.   We can hear the SHOWER RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant spots his face in a mirror above the dresser. He moves in close to the mirror, and stares at his own image

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls on his face a little, his eyes brimming with excitement. He smiles at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks toward the open bathroom door, where he hears the running shower. He creeps toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant peeks around the doorway. Starla is in the shower, soaping herself. She looks beautiful there. Grant tilts his head to the side like a dog. He watches her, mesmerized, even moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla is wearing a white towel and brushing her wet hair in the foggy bathroom mirror when she hears Air Supply's EVERY WOMAN IN THE WORLD coming from the bedroom. She's struck by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves toward the door.   Opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shades are drawn, darkening the room. A few candles have been lit. Grant is standing there, mostly in silhouette. He's silent, and he doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, sugarplum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at him, stirred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't heard this for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant walks toward her. He takes her hand in his own, lifting it beside him. He wraps his other arm around her waist. And he slow dances with her. Starla dances too, a bit hesitantly, a bit shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never danced in a towel before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing white, just like on our... wedding day. I remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about last night. I get a little insecure sometimes, want to hold on too tight. It's just 'cause you're precious to me, Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I swear to God, baby, I'm turning over a new Goddamn leaf. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods, touched.    Grant's eyes are teary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, sugarplum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla and Grant kiss, tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant falls to his knees in front of her. He runs his hand over the curve of her hip, her thigh, her buttock, with as much fascination as lust. He pushes Starla back onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her leg, and kisses it, nibbles on it a little, scrapes his teeth on it. Starla is surprised by this, but enjoys it too: it's probably the most foreplay she's had in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant crawls on top of her, runs his hands over her breasts, her face. Starla's hand moves over Grant's back, and to his stomach. When she stops, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes down at the wound between them, on Grant's bare abdomen, where the spore entered him. The wound is yellowish, and surrounded by veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, embarrassed, pulls his shirt down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little bug bite is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant kisses and munches on Starla as she lies back on the bed, enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla is HUMMING Every Woman in the World as she drops coins into a soda machine and chooses Tab. JANENE, a heavyset black teacher, notices this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you so smiley about, girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla grabs her soda and sits down with Janene.   Janene just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, Grant and I had a nice morning. It's been a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! You got that fresh-fucked glow, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shame.   You're a married woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was... considerate. Maybe this is the start of a real change in Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is holding up his shirt, and looking at his torso. The wound on his side is blackened and gangrenous, and is starting to puff up into a veiny little spout. A fuzzy bluish moss is growing in the crevices around the spout. A pus oozes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks concerned. He squirts some Neosporin onto his fingers. He massages it slowly into the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant opens the refrigerator door and rummages around inside. He pulls out some bread. Some cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the meat drawer. It's replete with cold cuts. He pulls out some Oscar Mayer baloney. Turkey. Pastrami and salami. He grabs every type of meat there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant assembles a sandwich at the table. Two pieces of bread and some cheese. He starts putting the meat on. But he can't stop, piling more and more on until he has a little sandwich tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at it. Something seems off about it. He removes the cheese. Better. And then the bread. Even better. He stares at what is now simply a tower of cold cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After contemplating it for a moment, Grant stands and carries off the pile of meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant enters the garage through a door from the FOYER. He flips the lights on with his shoulder. He looks around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant spots an old file cabinet. He sets the tower of meat down on the oily floor and opens a drawer. It's filled with files. He closes that drawer, and opens another. It has manila file folders, but no files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant takes out the folders. He uses a Sharpie to write out "BALONEY" on a folder. Then he stuffs all the baloney into the folder and files it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts writing out "PASTRAMI".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant flips through his alphabetically-filed meat: from "BALONEY" through "TURKEY." But he doesn't look satisfied

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stands beside the butcher's counter with a shopping cart. He peers dreamily in through the glass at the rows of steaks, pork chops, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Mr. Grant. You goin' to the Deer Cheer this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant snaps out of his reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing, killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinkin' 'bout getting me a couple of these big ol' rib eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stares at the steaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... having us a little dinner party... I'd say... eight. No, no... fourteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butcher nods, starts to grab steaks.   Grant CHUCKLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, what am I holding back for? Why don't you just give me everything you got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the rib eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. And while you're at it, get me a few of them chicken wings... some pork loins... and, ooo, what's this here? Osso buco?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant backs his pickup toward the garage. Meat is piled into the bed. Wrapped packages of meat fill the seats around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stands in the garage, tearing open the packing, and letting the loose meat slide into piles onto the floor, muttering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant rolls slabs of beef over the dirty floor and into a pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOMETHING skitters across the garage and around the pile. Grant peers around the pile and sees a RAT nibbling on some ribs. He realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rat moves away from Grant. But Grant snaps out his arm with alarming speed, snatching the rat. It SQUEAKS and wriggles in his grip, tearing and biting at him, tryi to get free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant snaps its neck, and tosses the dead rat onto the pile of meat. Continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla pulls into the driveway.     She presses the butto on her garage door opener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SHUDDERS but stays closed.    Starla's confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out of the car and examines the door. She looks down and sees a new padlock, locking the door to the ceme driveway with bolts on both sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla enters the house. She heads toward a door along the wall that leads to the garage. There's a shiny new lock on that door as well. She touches it, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to see Grant standing at the end of the foyer. He's in shadows, a little spooky in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant? Why are there -- did you put locks on the garage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.   No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drilled into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant walks into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeahhhh. I'm sorry. I just got so excited about... your present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my princess, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a super-special birthday present for you this year. I couldn't risk you finding it, so I had to put them locks on the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... I have to clean up before dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant smiles at her. Starla confused, tries to smile back, then turns and heads up the stairs. Grant watches Starla's fine form from behind, somewhat lustily. But his leering gaze gradually turns into something darker, and he has a realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant snaps himself out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothin'.   Nothin'.   See you in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla smiles uneasily, and heads on upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant steps onto the front porch to get some air. He's blinking and seems a little dizzy. He gazes around the neighborhood:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the way, a BOY in a little league uniform and his MOTHER get out of their car and walk toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, THROUGH A KITCHEN WINDOW, a PLUMP MAN and his WIFE are eating dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At another home, a SHORT MAN steps on a stepladder, changing the dome light on his porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stares at these individuals, looking like an animal ready to lunge at its prey, fighting the urge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HEARS a BARKING. Grant turns to see the beagle next door, tied to the tree, YAPPING at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks around to make sure no one's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla walks to get the paper in her robe, and she sees a BOY, aged thirteen or so, stapling a LOST: REWARD flyer to a telephone pole, with a picture of the beagle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roscoe's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy's face is streaked from a long night of crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen him, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he'll show up, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy nods, and walks to the next telephone pole to put up another flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant moves up a hill, between trees, looking around for something. He comes to a stop, trying to remember which way to go. He does, and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant comes upon an old wooden barn. The structure is maybe a hundred years old, and long abandoned. It's spattered with graffiti. Grant stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant gathers large fronds and other foliage in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant spreads the plant life over the floor of the barn. He arranges it, fluffs it there. His actions are very animal-like when no one's around. He seems to be making a nest. He sits back, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, dressed in her weekend finery, is looking in the mirror above her dresser, and putting on earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, are you almost ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks ill. He is leaning over the sink, sweating, clutching his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hon, I'll be right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant turns and pushes open his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sees Starla sitting on the edge of the bed, her back to him, as she puts on her nylons. She doesn't know he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stares at her, demented, and moves slowly toward her, stalking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something starts to push Grant's shirt up at his stomach, like a bellybutton erection. The thing slips out of his shirt -- a writhing, pointy tubule, aiming toward Starla' back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks at the nape of Starla's neck.    Her delicate ear. He becomes confused; he softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns to see Grant, his body now turned away from her. He's trying to push the tubule back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods, confused by his behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner hangs across the front of the lodge, "DEER CHEER '05" -- the first Friday of deer season in Wheelsy. Inflatable deer totems decorate the front of the wooden lodge. RAMBUNCTIOUS MUSIC comes from inside. Partyers enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant and Starla step out of his truck. As they do, one of Starla's students, Will, sees her and waves. Starla waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant notices this and grabs Starla's arm, a bit too hard pulling her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just one of my students, Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stares at the boy with distrust, and ushers Starla towards the lodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Trevor and Margaret are hanging out on a large rock outside the entranceway, drinking beer. Bill watches Grant and Starla cross the lot. Trevor sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she see in that douchebag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the mystery of the ages there, Trev. Starla was seventeen when they got engaged. He was, like, in his thirties. No one even knew they were goin' out till she had that ring on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no mystery to it. She's raised in them shanties off St. Luc. Dirt-poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold-digger, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you don't know that, Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret shrugs, BELCHES. Jack, the mayor, with his WIFE, stops beside them after she does, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, you're Chief of police now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes with some Goddamn responsibility, like keeping your people in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Jack.    Margaret, you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret and Trevor LAUGH. Jack shakes his head with disdain, and enters the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheelsy citizens celebrate.   A country-western band PLAY Couples two-step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla and Grant move through the party. Grant looks around at the dancing and laughing bodies. Starla sees her friend from school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janene!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janene LAUGHS heartily and the two embrace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two catch up? I'll go see what the boys are doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods. She and Janene watch as Grant moves off through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been strange the past couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant steps outside, and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the parking lot is a playground. Two YOUNG CHILDRE are spinning on a little carousel there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant starts toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Children GIGGLE, unaware of Grant inching up on them. Grant gets closer, excited, when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant turns and see Brenda Gutierrez standing there. Once again, she's very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be fate, us meeting again like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you might be right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sees if anyone's watching.   He circles around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lookin' awful pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda SNICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the old half-Mexican?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took the kids to his Mom's for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant holds Brenda's hand, and he pulls her between the trees. She GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you takin' me, you bad boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant stops in a secluded place, beside the creek, lookin around. No one's there. He turns toward her, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt, doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda looks at him, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's hard to explain how amazin' a human brain is to someone who that's all they know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff you can never imagine. Feelings. Big thoughts. And love. Yeah. I'm inclined to parlay it into somethin' more. So, go ahead there, beautiful, and take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, though startled, leans back on a boulder and star unbuttoning her blouse. After a moment, she looks at Grant, trying to be sexy while she does it. Grant looks at her in her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant unbuttons his shirt as well.    As he removes it completely, he turns toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda sees the wound on his stomach has blossomed into a veiny, blue-moss-encrusted yellow spout, huge and pulsing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant!?    What -- ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grabs her.    She tries to push his arms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda gets up, trying to run away. But Grant grabs her necklace, yanking her back. The necklace snaps and falls into the creek beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant pins Brenda's wrists against the rock.    She strug to get free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's eyes widen as she looks down to see the writhing tentacle-like tubule emerge from Grant's wound. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant shoves his hand over her mouth, shutting her up. He's extremely strong. She watches as the tubule twitches feeling its way like a blind snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tubule comes to rest on her abdomen. Tears stream down from Brenda's eyes. It pushes into her flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda goes into convulsions. Something -- a fluid -- pumps through the tubule and into Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant watches Brenda without emotion as her body spasms there beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she falls back, unconscious.   The tubule retracts into Grant's torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla is leaning over a wooden rail, looking at the ligh of the town below. She turns to see Bill lean on the rail beside her. She looks genuinely happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla catches herself, and looks around to see if Grant is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. The lurker ain't around. I checked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha' doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tryin' to get a buzz on. But I'm too buff. Too much muscle mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking out the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Starla look out over the city together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty, ain't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I've seen them so many times before. I guess any spot gets boring after awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's only if you're in the wrong spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place over there on the bluffs. When the fog is just right, like tonight, the lights of Main look like a kaleidoscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm hm. But only a few folks know how to get there. Wally. Rollo Linkski coulda taken you, but 'course he got hit by that train. Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get Wally to show me sometime then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla LAUGHS out loud.   So does Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, will you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARLA                            GRANT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Rollo's ghost.               Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see Grant approaching.     He's a mess.   Hi pants are streaked with mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant eyes Bill with suspicion.    He grabs Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready, sugarplum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods.   She looks at Bill and mouths:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill watches Grant and Starla head off, as he downs the rest of his beer. Wally walks up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised you're able to lift a mug after carrying that torch for so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Wally. Glad you're here. There was something I wanted to tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill SNAPS his fingers, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.     Fuck you, fat ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla lies on her side, awake. She's staring at the dirt on Grant's pants, which are hung over a valet. Grant holds her from behind, sleeping peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of the precinct opens, and a confused Mexican MAN walks inside. He is trying to keep from crying. Three half-naked children follow him, clutching onto his clothes. The man walks slowly through the office looking around for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret sees him from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, may I help -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife, Brenda. I think something has happened to her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, in her car with groceries, comes to a stop sign. She looks at the telephone pole beside it and sees that it's covered with flyers for missing pets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla enters with a shopping bag.    The lights are off. CREEPY MUSIC plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.    Starla tries to turn on the lights, but not happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes the door to the garage, noticing the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sets down the bags on the counter, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, no one's here. She sees a potted flower on the counter. A green INCHWORM is crawling up the stem, little by little. She stares at it, as if it's a portent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a MOAN, coming from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla moves slowly into this dark room, looking for her husband. It seems no one is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, where are y -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns, when Grant POPS INTO FRAME. Starla, startled, SCREAMS. Grant is sick and trembling. But, worse, he's been transforming. There are small pustules all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant. Oh my God. What happened to your -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh. It ain't as bad as it looks, sugarplum. Dr. Carl was just here. I had a reaction to a bee sting. He gave me a prescription. Said I should be fine, in a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stares at him, mute and horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like that, baby. Please? I'm gonna go get my... prescription filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant grabs his keys off the dresser, puts them in his pocket, trying to pretend he doesn't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get if for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   No.   Heh.     I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves outside the door, leaving Starla, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too dark to see much in here, but we do see Grant putting meat into a garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks around to make sure no one's looking, as he places the garbage bag full of meat into his trunk, close it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant moves through the forest, in massive pain, dragging the garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant comes upon the old wooden barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant enters. It is almost completely dark.          He h WEEPING. CHAINS RATTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant peers over at Brenda, mostly in silhouette, sitting on the nest he has made. She's chained up and MOANS through a mouth gag. Grant walks to her. Her body is horribly pear-shaped and misshapen, like some tumorous pregnancy. Grant pulls her gag away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant? Grant, I'm hungry. I'm so fuckin' hungry I think I'm gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought you munchies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant pours the garbage bagful of rotting meat and dead animals out in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been saving for a rainy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP: Brenda's face, still mostly in darkness. She stares at the meat, simultaneously excited and repulsed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, I'm sorry if I did something wrong! I think I gotta -- I think I should go to a hospital!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant doesn't respond.    Brenda's eyes trail back down t the meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's hand reaches out, and grabs a maggot-infested pork chop, pulling it toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR, but can barely see, Brenda CHOWING DOWN on the raw pork in the nearly pitch black barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant gets into his pickup; he trembles and YELPS as his body is wracked with pain and his body starts to transfor even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a HARD KNOCKING on Starla's door. She swings it open to see Bill and Wally standing there, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally tries to see inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   He went to the pharmacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pharmacy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a... rash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally exchange a glance -- maybe this means something. Starla can see Trevor and Margaret, across the street, talking to another neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, you know Brenda Gutierrez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's ever called the house, or -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappeared Friday night. We got reason to believe foul play might be involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kids found her necklace near Tipper Creek, as well as what might be her blood on a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem, Starla, is, the last person anyone saw her talking to was Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deer Cheer. And Wally and me, we also saw him that night, with mud all over his slacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hands her his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have him call me right away, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods, distraught. Bill tries to smile kindly befor he and Wally move out and off to canvas other neighbors' homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla closes the door behind her, distraught, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the foyer door, leading into the garage. Her eyes fall down to the floor, where she sees what appears to be blood drop stains near the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gains courage, and moves off toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla throws open this door. She looks at old, unused sports equipment. She grabs an aluminum baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla holds the aluminum bat, standing in front of the door to the garage. She hesitates a moment. But then she swings the bat at the lock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings it again, GRUNTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the lock is knocked off the wooden door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla pushes away the useless lock, letting it fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla steels herself, and slowly pushes open the door into the dark garage. As she does, the horrendous stench hits her. Terrified, she covers her face with her hand, and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sees what's there: not only a huge stockpile of rotten meat, but a dozen dead pets. They are neatly divided into various categories, and labeled: Pork, Groun Beef, Cats, Dogs. The walls and doorway have been heavily insulated so the smell doesn't sink into the home. She looks on the floor and sees poor, dead Roscoe the beagle, his tongue dangling out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves quickly back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla runs to the front picture window, and looks out onto the street. She can't see any of the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns from the window and picks up a cordless phone. She looks at the card Bill gave her, and dials the number The phone RINGS, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've reached Chief Pardy at the Wheelsy Police Department. Please leave a message and your call will be returned as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a BEEP.    Starla tries to speak through her SOBS pacing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, it's Starla!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Starla passes the large picture window, she doesn't see Grant staring in at her, his face now that of some diseased cephalopod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's -- I think you better come over right away -- I think Grant's sick, he --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns to see the monstrous Grant through the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just stops.   They stare at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Grant lets out a FURIOUS WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns and dashes toward the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant disappears from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Starla runs through here, she looks behind her at the front door to make sure Grant isn't following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs past a wall of family photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sees the door on the rear of the house, leading to the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She arrives at it, and flings it open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges onto her. Starla SCREAMS and drops the cordless phone, just as it starts RINGING. Grant crawls on top of her body. Starla reaches for the ringing phone, but he pins her hands above her head. He looks into her eyes. He's CRYING. His voice and breath are sick and raspy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you betray me, sugarplum?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved you.     I loved --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant, you're sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you by my side, but you -- I can't trust you now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla's WEEPING, confused. Grant rips his shirt open. Starla looks down to see the tubule protruding from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: now enormous yellow spore on Grant's chest. The tubule feels over Starla's blouse, and then slips beneath it. It starts to poke into her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla grabs the leg of a coffee table beside her. She SLAMS the table into Grant's head. This hurts and surprises him sufficiently to let Starla get out from under him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla grabs the cordless phone, which is no longer ringing, and scurries behind the couch. She dials 9-1-1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant thrusts the couch aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla crawls away again, when Grant attacks her from behind. He wraps his arm around her neck, pulling her back. He looks down at her with his sick, angry eyes, as his arm -- now apparently jointless -- curls around her like a snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla gasps for air. Her face turns purple.   She hears a SLAMMING on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla?!!   Starla, are you in there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla tries to speak but she cannot.   Suddenly, we HEAR the FRONT DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, with barely an ounce of life left in her, sees Bill, Wally, Trevor and Margaret burst into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are surprised, to say the least, to see this disease humanoid strangling Starla from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops, freaked out, pull their guns. Grant makes a SCREECHING SOUND at them. They SHOOT at Grant, nicking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant jumps away from Starla, back into the shadows, SCREECHING in anger and pain. Starla falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slips out the back door and away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops stare, gape-jawed and frozen with shock; what the hell was THAT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla rubs her neck, COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Pardy runs toward the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs out into the backyard. Wally runs up behind him. They look around at the trees surrounding the area. Grant is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CRANE UP and AWAY from them as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, these past few days have been a trying time for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN OVER an altar where family members have placed little items that remind them of Brenda -- photographs, mementos, "Come home, Mommy" cards, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ask you now for the safe return of our beloved Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in this modest little church has their heads bowed as the PASTOR leads the prayer service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our sister. Our daughter.    Our mother. Our wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda's husband, in the front pew, loses it, CRYING. His little children, beside him, fiddle in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we ask that you keep your light alive in her heart, wherever she may be. We ask all this in your name, Lord. Amen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill Pardy is here, in full uniform, hat in hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL                               CONGREGATION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.                            Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks around the church. He spots Starla, in the very back of church, head down, distraught, guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also sees a group of OLD CRONES nearby, pointing at Starla, and whispering about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla's high heels CLACK on the pavement as she moves quickly to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla turns to see Bill coming after her.   She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to the CDC. They didn't have nothin' on file consistent with Grant's... symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Brenda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New? No. We're hoping we find Grant, he'll lead us to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods. The wind is strong. Her hair is flying over her face. Tears come to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill enters. A few COPS and SECRETARIES are bustling, making phone calls, etc. They all look tired, as if they haven't slept. Jack, the mayor, sees Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill spots him, moving quickly toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, we need to talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Mornin', Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill crosses the station.   Jack follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, this Brenda's Randy Flagg's niece. We need to find Grant yesterday! The town council has lit a Roman candle and stuck it up my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, Jack, your leisure activities ain't my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me, Bill. Your post here as Chief is in dire straits you don't work this shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a desk with Wally and Trevor working away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll find him. (to Trevor) Anything new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude's a half-squid. Ain't many places he can hide. Sea World, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack sees a SECRETARY making copies nearby.    He speaks hushed tones:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That young lady heard you say 'squid.' She's gonna go out and create a Goddamn hysteria!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry, you gonna create a hysteria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, quit that talk! You yourself said it was dark in there! You don't know what you saw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw his arm was all bendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard obviously got lyme disease!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch some deer feces out in the forest. Eat a sandwich without washing your hands. Then you got lyme disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that makes you look like a squid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what, no one with lyme disease gonna win any damn handsome contests!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Wally, and Trevor can't help but SNICKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, screw you all for laughin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks over at Shelby, on his headset at the dispatch unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ranch attack!   Up at the Castavets'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods for Trevor and Margaret to get up from their desks. They do, and start to move out with Bill and Wally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Ranch a -'?   What 'ranch attacks'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: A dead rottweiler is lying on its back in the long grass, its gut split open and intestines spilling out, almost perfectly symmetrical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like one of them psyche tests. What do they call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally are staring at the dog from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see? I see a butterfly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill moves on through the windswept weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see we're fucked.   Three ranches in three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret is taking measurements and writing in a note pad; she sees Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I think I got it part-way figured. You want to hear it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Grant -- I mean, we're saying this is Grant, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant kills a cow right about here. See there's the blood, musta slit its neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret walks backward, showing the trail of blood in the crushed grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he drags the cow backwards here. Only he prolly didn't know 'bout the Castavets had them dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks over at Trevor, standing up between the tall weeds, holding a dog's head in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knocked this'n's head clear over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that down, numbnuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill peers at the various slaughtered dogs around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the dogs attacked, somehow he slew 'em all, and he stole off with the cow into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor heads toward them. Bill looks off into the dark forest on the edge of the ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta be in the forest. All three ranches run alongside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think we should get up a search party, head in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hundred thousand acres. Be finding a needle in a fuckstack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill has a realization.   He moves quickly for his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally, come on. Trevor and Margaret, get some folks together. I think I know where he's gonna hit next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP: A property map of Wheelsy is tacked to a bulleti board. Red Magic Marker circles are around various ranch properties on the edge of the city, next to an enormous forest. A finger points to one of the red circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the night after Grant ran off, a calf went missing from here, the Raglans' ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Bill, standing beside the bulletin board. A posse has gathered, listening intently: Wally and the usual cops; Jack; an OLDER COP, probably pulled out of retirement; and a couple of recruits -- a REDNECK and a GOOD OL' BOY. Bill points to the next red circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two nights ago, a mare was stolen from this property, run by Fitzgibbon, that old rancher with the cleft palate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally whispers to Margaret, amused:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a chipmunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your momma wasn't too proud when you came out neither, Wally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill points to the next circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we get here, the Castavets', where last night's shit-storm took place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. It's like as if he's going in a pattern. Is that what you're saying, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods and points to the next red circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he sticks to that pattern he'll be here next. Belongs to a family, the Strutemyers'. Now I know y'all are tired and you've barely seen your families. But we're gonna have to go there tonight, lie low and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse nod, agreeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get that son-of-a-bitch, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, we don't know what we're up against here. So let's be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside a small armory, Trevor loads a Benelli M-1 super semiautomatic shotgun. Margaret checks the site on a Remington 700 PSS rifle. Bill takes a Springfield M-1A pump-action for himself, while Wally stuffs numerous pistols and ammo into a leather satchel. Trevor notices a dusty grenade on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill, we got that grenade we confiscated from them jokers wanted to use it fish for trout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks at Trevor, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Trevor puts the grenade into a side-pocket on the satchel, Bill sees Jack and the Older Cop, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know the Russkies were invading there, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen this guy, you'd wished they was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse loads up their vehicles, and start taking off out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally walk out to their police car.   Bill tosse the leather satchel into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in the car, Bill starts the engine, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla Grant pulls quickly into the parking lot. Bill rolls down the window as she gets out of her car and runs toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I heard what you're doing. I think I should go along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Listen, it doesn't matter. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill starts to roll away, but Starla holds on to the car, following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Dammit, Bill, if that girl's still out there, how will you find her? How, unless you bring Grant in alive? Your best chance of doing that is with me. I can talk to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill you, Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did. I know. But I got him angry 'cause I wasn't calm. This time I could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla's on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Bill. What happened, it's my fault, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, it ain't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. He'd been acting strange. And the physical changes. I should have told someone right away... But I was just blind. I wanted to pretend it wasn't happening... If I don't do what I can to help now, I just couldn't live with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks at her.   He looks at Wally.     Wally shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods for Starla to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is blowing on a cup of coffee. Her MOM, DAD, and two younger SISTERS, aged 9 and 11, are relaxing after dinner. As Kylie's Mom picks up plates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie! What'd you do to your fingers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Mom grabs her hand, looking at her very long fingernails. They're painted sky blue and spotted with minute teddy bear and bumblebee decals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiri Goshima done 'em.    She's Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Pokemons done 'em to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's sisters LAUGH out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foreign stuff is classy if you knew something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's family sees, OUT THE WINDOW, police cars pulling up by a gravel road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. There's Jack. I want y'all to stay inside tonight. All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's sisters nod.   Kylie too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Dad steps onto the front porch of this quaint family farmhouse. He sees Jack heading toward the ranch, and waves. Jack gives a little salute, while muttering to the Older Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This turns out to be a mountain lion we're gonna look like a damn bunch of idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redneck and Good Ol' Boy make their way to the ranch as well. They see Bill with Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know it was date night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Ol' Boy LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be expecting you toss my salad at the end of all this then, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse fans out over this grassy land where the cattle graze, finding places to hide. The sun sets behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness has crept over the ranch, and the beautiful, pastoral scene has become distinctly more sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows hard, WHISTLING through the long weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rusty rooster windmill atop the old barn twists and CLINKS on its half-bent perch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
