dialogues.text: A piece of tarp hangs down from the barn roof, FLAPPING incessantly against the wooden wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Jack; the Redneck and the Good Ol' Boy; and Margaret and the Older Cop are hidden around the ranch, waiting, watching or dozing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the barn, the wind is only slightly quieter, and it's darker. Bill, Starla, and Wally are here. Bill peers out through the doorway at cattle drinking from the trough. He looks at Starla; her head tilts to the side as she nods off. When her head falls all the way, she snaps back up, and catches Bill gazing at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods and smiles. She doesn't smile back; she's embarrassed and miserable and this is the last place she wants to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit there for a moment in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Starla, remember that time when you were a kid and you came knocking on my window in the middle of the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla here's twelve. Guess I was fourteen. I said, 'Starla, what the hell you doing out there?' She tells me she's running away to Hollywood to become a big star. She said she knew I was in ROTC, and she was gonna need a bodyguard. Invited me along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally LAUGHS. Bill smiles. Starla is embarrassed, but grudgingly enjoys the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, 'Starla, if there's anybody can take care of herself, I think it's you. I'm gonna have to decline.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Starla) How far'd you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the bus stop. Ranger Rick here called my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! A cop from the get-go!   You son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked up our fame and fortune, Bill Pardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smokes a cigarette as he keeps an eye out for the cow killer. The burning ember of the cigarette is blown off by the wind. Jack searches for it in the dry grass, trying to catch it before it starts a fire. He crawls forward, slapping the ground, when he glances up and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, shadowy shape hulking through the trees on the edge of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Starla, and Wally see Grant Grant emerging from the forest. He has transformed into something much more monstrous: a giant, gangrenous, slug-like beast, a clump of cells and tumor-like protuberances. He has various tentacle-like-arms growing out of him, like overgrown eyes on a potato. As opposed to just having the disease, he now seems to BE the disease itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Trevor watch in amazement as Grant slithers acro the field, his large, dark, watery eyes searching out prey. Jack turns to Trevor, pissed, and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said 'squid'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redneck and the Good Ol' Boy watch too, mouths droppe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased Grant slithers through the grass just a few feet beside Margaret and the Older Cop. They duck below the grass, looking as if they're going to have heart attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant approaches a cow. The cow makes a little MOO of protest when he gets too close, and steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grant-creature stabs one of his tentacle growths into the cow's neck, piercing it. The cow stumbles, choking. Blood spurts from her neck. And she topples over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally stare out the window, motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we gonna do now, Bill?   Cuffs won't even fit on 'im.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla musters courage.   She stands, and moves out of th barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, where you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant wraps a feeler around the cow's horns, and starts dragging it back in the direction of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill motions through the barn window to Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret motions to Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor motions to the recruits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Starla moves slowly in toward Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant turns and looks at her with his half-human eyes. His breathing is loud, raspy, and sick. He sees, in a wide circle around him, the nervous posse standing up, their guns at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla moves even closer.   Bill and Wally are coming in close behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?   It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Starla and the posse get closer, Grant looks almost scared. His eyes dart around from cop to cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just sick is all. But we'll take you to get help right now. I'll stay by your side, Grant, just like I swore I would. For better or worse. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant's huge milky eyes betray that he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse inch in closer, tightening the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant lets out a PIERCING SCREECH of protest.    All of t posse stop, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is quiet and still except for Grant's gross breathing. Deep: In, out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Grant?    It's gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant SCREECHES again: a warning. He looks from Starla to Bill, with hurt, jealous eyes, and GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Grant's eyes close to half-mast, and he turns away. His tentacle tightens around the cow's horns, and he agai drags it toward the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Bill tries to decide what to do, the Good Ol' Boy nervously blocks Grant's path. He aims his pistol at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stop right there, you son of a bitch. I don't care what kinda leprosy you got. We need to find that girl. Now you can make this peaceful, or you can make it hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.   Grant and the Good Ol' Boy stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Grant SNAPS out a tentacle-arm, whipping it up the front of the man's body, and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front of the Good Ol' Boy's whole body is split neatl in half. For a split second, he remains alive: the two different sides of his split head look down in disbelief as his organs spill out from inside him. And then he topples over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!   Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse SHOOT at Grant.    Starla covers her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is struck; he SCREECHES in pain. He lets go of the cow. He slithers with incredible speed off toward the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and the other posse members take off after him like hounds on the heel of their prey. They SHOOT madly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla watches as the posse follows Grant into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stands alone and worried a moment, and then she darts off after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is running a bath.    She hears GUNSHOTS ECHO in th distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She peers out a little window above the tub, trying to see where the shots are coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse run through this very dark forest after Grant, leaping over brush and rocks. They're nervous, but also excited, as the primordial hunting urge takes over. Their eyes are filled with anger and bloodlust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're able to follow Grant only by catching glimpses -- a flash of flesh between trees, a tentacle disappearing around brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is!     Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They FIRE at the creature, taking chunks out of trees, but missing. He's too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant slips around a boulder and splashes through a creek and into the plentiful trees beyond. He rustles thick fronds as he moves up alongside the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse run up the creek itself, splashing, trying to peer through the leaves to get a shot at Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, carrying his revolver, trips and falls in the creek He cuts his knee on a sharp rock. He stands, and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse come up out of the creek. They've completely lost track of the diseased man-beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop, out-of-breath and looking around.   They whisp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't never gonna find that girl now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redneck is WEEPING with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill that asshole what he did to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill sees Starla run up behind them.    He waves her back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla takes a couple steps back, but doesn't leave. She watches there, half in shadows as the posse creep around, searching for some trail of Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret looks down into the bubbling creek. She sees it's turning red. She looks up the trail of red, which is rippling downhill in the water. The red flow starts somewhere near a boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally are searching in front of the boulder. Margaret SEES, but they don't, Grant pulling himself up on a tree branch and RISING behind them. Blood from a shotgun wound is dripping into the creek. Grant, pissed, lifts a tentacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill turns as the tentacle swings down toward him. He falls back; the tentacle slashes inches from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill BLASTS his shotgun up at Grant, but Grant is already slithering swiftly back into the thick brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse squeeze themselves though the brush, following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse emerge on the other side of the brush, only to be confronted by a terrible odor. They cover their noses and mouths as their faces shrivel in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse gaze up at the old ramshackle barn where Grant had brought Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from in there, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret looks at Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he's inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill takes the lead, carefully approaching the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse follows, their weapons drawn. The closer they get to the barn, the more unbearable the smell becomes. Only Bill, intent on the task in front of him, doesn't react to the stench at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill leans his ear in close to the front door, and listen Through the door he can HEAR a QUIET SOBBING. Bill and Wally exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill steps back. He and Wally aim their shotguns at the door. Bill nods to Margaret, and gestures for her to open it. Starla watches all this from the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret swings open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally move cautiously but quickly inside.   But they stop suddenly, in disgust and horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Brenda. And she doesn't look good. Her weepy little head is stuck to the front of a huge fleshy orb, which is what her body has become. This enormous ball of flesh is nine or ten feet tall. Vestigial fingers protrude from the sides. She is utterly immobile. Her flesh sloshes, slightly and constantly; a thousand snakes seem to be slithering beneath her thin, tight, bruised skin. The woman is in great pain. She SOBS. Her mouth and chin are stained with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse and Starla enter behind Bill and Wally and are equally astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the source of the awful stench:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda is encircled by the rotting carcasses of cows and horses and forest critters. They are mostly skeletal, as they have been largely devoured. They're swarming with flies. The stench is so bad the posse cover their faces with the bottom of their shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOBBING Brenda looks desperately at Bill and Wally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Wally get in a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want no one to be seeing me like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the posse inch closer, Brenda's whole body suddenly LURCHES FORWARD a bit -- like whatever's inside her is trying to get out and to the posse. Brenda SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse jump back.    They stare as she recomposes hers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are my boys, Bill?    Are they all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys are fine, Brenda. Uh, what's -- what's happening here, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so fucking hungry, Bill. I'm so hungry. I just never knew anybody could be so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda tries to smile in a way she might charm her Daddy into giving her candy. This is creepy as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind handing me a piece of that possum there at your feet? Little bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor gags and runs out of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor vomits into some bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill eyes poor Brenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we best get you to a hospital right quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck they gonna do with her in a hospital, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Brenda SCREAMS.    Her body LURCHES FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's she doing that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her tumors is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, get her to stop that shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her body lurches forward AGAIN.     She sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!!     Help!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then AGAIN. Starla notices that Brenda's skin is starting to SPLIT AND TEAR on her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little fuckers are tearing me aparrrr- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda SCREAMS like a woman giving a thousand evil births at once and her body RIPS OPEN in one part; and then, in quick succession, ANOTHER, and ANOTHER. Bill looks out one of the windows. Grant is peering in at them, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He led us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Brenda's body BURSTS OPEN COMPLETELY, like a water balloon hitting cement, and thousands of little SLITHERING EYELESS PARASITES with slippery black-red skin like slugs spill forth. The horrid creatures, eight inche long and a few inches thick, swarm over the posse, completely covering them before they can react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sees the things flooding over the posse in the barn. The parasites are especially drawn to the posse's heads. Because there are so many, the weight of the beast knocks most of them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor runs, but the things make it out the doorway, covering him like lava in One Million B.C., and he buckle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parasite slithers quickly and fluidly into Wally's mout He gags on it. His eyes flip back up into his head, and his body starts to spasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tries to pull one away from his face, but it's too slippery and it disappears inside his mouth. His body, too, convulses, and he spits up blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill notices the parasites slithering into the mouths of the Redneck and the Older Cop as well; whites of their eyes, bodies convulsing, spewing blood. Bill sees the things oozing up Margaret's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret, cover your mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill sees Trevor outside the door in the dirt, trying to slap the parasites off. Bill yells to everyone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let 'em in your mouths!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One starts to get in Bill's mouth as he speaks, but he slaps it aside. Margaret pulls her shirt over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla SHRIEKS. She puts her hand over her mouth as the parasites rush up her. She's knocked over, and falls back onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parasite slithers between Starla's lips -- when, suddenly, a KNIFE thrusts down, pinning the creature to the dirt, stopping it from oozing further into Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is holding the knife in one hand, his other hand firmly over his mouth. Bill swats more incoming parasites away from Starla's mouth. He covers her mouth with his free hand. He lies on top of her, mushing their bodies and faces as closely together as possible so the things don't get into them. The parasites swarm all over them, flapping their slimy little tails as they try to fight their way inside their mouths. But Bill holds tight to himself and Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, the parasites give up on Bill and Starla, and begin to slither away. Bill watches as they crawl off the posse and filter out of the barn in a squirmy mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually, they're gone. Bill takes his hand from Starla's mouth. Starla looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Margaret lift her face from the ground, shiverin holding her shirt over her mouth. They gaze out the front door of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor pulls his face from the dirt and stands. He spits violently and wipes the dirt off his tongue with his wris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted us to eat 'em!   Why would they want that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is trying to make sense of it all. He gazes down at Brenda's body, her bloody skin and misshapen skeleton spread out over the floor, split open like an enormous bloody tiger rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around at the posse lying on the floor in mangle positions, their mouths and lips covered in blood, still lightly convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes out INTO THE FOREST to see the parasites rushing away like an ugly wormy army, shaking the brush as they head off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parasites crawl over rocks and out of the forest and onto the ranch. The Strutemyer farmhouse looms nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is taking a steamy bubble bath. Her head is back, her eyes shut; she's enjoying the warm water. The tub faucet drips lightly in an uneven rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasites squirm up the side of the house, sticking to the wood siding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie glances out the window beside the tub, at the starr sky and crescent moon, beautiful and still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK on the bathroom door. Kylie turns toward the door -- as she does, a parasite crawls across the window behind her, streaking a moist slimy trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie! You're gonna turn into a plum in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prune, Mom.    Plums turn into prunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Mom is at the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what turns into what. You got school tomorrow. Finish up in there and get to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. Kylie GRUNTS in vague agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Mom trots down the hall, to another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She KNOCKS once, then opens the door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's younger sisters lie in single beds, reading Goosebumps by bed-lamps clipped to the headboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to turn in, ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a couple more pages, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls SIGH in lazy protest, but still turn off their reading lamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYLIE'S SISTER 1                  KYLIE'S SISTER 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Mom.                     Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE WINDOW we see Kylie's Mom start to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tight.   Don't let the bed bugs bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numerous parasites slither INTO FRAME, up the side of the house, approaching the girls' bedroom window, which is open a few inches for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Mom shuts their door completely. The girls turn on their sides and close their eyes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the parasites pour in through the cracked window. They slither over the walls. Their slimy black-red bodies contrast sharply with the pretty flowered wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door cracks open, and a parasite enters.   It slither silently over the linoleum tiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It arrives at the base of the tub, and crawls up the side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie continues relaxing, her eyes closed. She doesn't see the parasite enter the soapy bath water at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie hears a SOFT SPLASHING and peers down. She spots the creature swimming toward her between her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie SHRIEKS and scrambles up to get out of the tub. she clamors out, she slips and falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite squirms up Kylie's wet naked back. Kylie SHRIEKS again, jumping up as she tries to slap the thing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite winds toward her lips. Kylie goes to grab it with both hands, but it slips through them. The thing slides into Kylie's mouth as she looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie snatches the very end of the parasite's tail. Her long, teddy-bear-spotted fingernails pinch it there, digging into the parasite's flesh, barely stopping it from sliding completely into her mouth. It wildly flaps its tail like a docked trout, desperate to enter her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie falls to her knees. Her eyes roll back in her head, and her body spasms while she holds tenuously onto the very tip of the parasite's tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We TRACK IN to a CLOSEUP of Kylie's face: a slight white electrical-telepathic charge can be seen SPARKING inside her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are RUSHING through some amoebic landscape, PAST microbes and cytoplasm and cells, and to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the memories of some creature not of earth. Its eyesight is not like our own; it's in grainy black and white and amber outlines. Various images FLASH in quick succession, including the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We are on top of an alien ANIMAL, pinning it down. HOWLS beneath us as we tear into its flesh, feasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- All around us, diseased monstrous BEASTS feed on more alien animals. They lunge toward them and pin them down, ripping them apart, like some National Geographic documentary shot in Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- In FAST MOTION, unfamiliar plant life around us grows sick and withers, dying out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A group of diseased monstrous beasts CRY OUT in unifor pain. They buckle to their knees; now they're dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The diseased beasts feed on their own appendages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie tries to regain control of her mind. Her eyes fight against flipping back in her head. Tears pour down her face. She pulls the parasite out just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then it SLAMS back into her and there are more SPARKS inside her mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We are CLIMBING UP through a creamy, gelatinous yellow An opening slit widens in front of us, and we see Grant slowly bending to look at us, the forest behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We watch Starla soaping herself in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We make love to Starla, our hands on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We sit over a convulsing Brenda, impregnating her with our tubule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We see the posse members coming in toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a last, desperate effort, Kylie yanks at the exhaust worm, pulling it fully from her mouth. It flaps in her fingers. Kylie spits up blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie tosses the parasite away from her. Though slightly crippled, the little bastard writhes back toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie spots her curling iron on the counter; it's plugged in, the red light is on. She grabs it, and swings it into the wormy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite SQUEAKS and trembles with pain. Smoke rises from it as Kylie digs the curling iron in deeper, burning it, and, finally, killing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie lifts the iron in front of her and looks at it. The dead parasite is stuck to it, dangling from the metal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie drops the iron. She quickly steps into her clothes lying on the floor. She runs out of the bathroom and into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie runs to the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!    Mom!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie stops. Dozens of the things are slithering up the stairs and up the handrail towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. Kylie hears her SISTERS' SCREAMS.   She looks in the direction, running toward their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily!!    Jenna!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie tosses open her sisters' door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's youngest sister is on her knees on the bed, a parasite sticking out of her mouth. Her eyes are rolled back. Her arms flail spastically. The slithering beast wags its tail as it disappears down her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's other sister is backing into a corner, with parasites crawling up her body. She's SCREAMING bloody hell, trying to slap them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie runs toward her to help. Kylie slaps the parasites off her sister. But there's too many and they're too fast. They slide into her sister's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!   Nooo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her sister's eyes flip back in her skull as the thing disappears completely, and she starts spitting up blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie sees the parasites around the room coming at her. There's a clear path toward a window. Kylie runs to the window, and shoves it open. As the things approach her, she crawls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie steps onto this shingled, angled canopy over the front porch. She turns to see the parasites slithering out towards her. She looks down. It's probably too far to jump, but she has no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she jumps down onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie lands, hard, tumbling over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances back at the front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE KITCHEN WINDOW she sees her Mom and Dad, eyes rolled back, convulsing, spitting up blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More parasites are crawling towards Kylie through the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots her family's old Luv pickup truck on the drivew in front of her. She breaks for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws open the front door, and jumps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things approach, crawling in after her. Kylie tries to slam the door shut, but it won't; many things are stuc in the door jamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SQUEAK in a chorus of pain, trying to wriggle toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she SLAMS the door AGAIN, and AGAIN, and she slices the little bastards in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie makes sure none are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She feels for the keys in the ignition.    There aren't any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creatures crawl up and over all the pickup's windows, trying to get in. Slithery shadows cover over Kylie, leaving her in almost complete darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie crouches down in on herself, and WAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, Trevor, and Margaret stand, wide-eyed and shaken. All three seem to be in some mild state of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, suppressing his desperation, is trying to make contact on his police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11-41. We're gonna need paramedics out here right away. We got four men down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill listens for a response, but there's only STATIC. presses the button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, only STATIC.    Bill tries another frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, this is Bill.     We got an emergency here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill steps outside the doorway, to see if he can get reception. Trailing off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sees Wally's body on the floor. His skin is white and corpse-like. His mouth is streaked with blood. Starla crouches beside him, and takes his pulse. Her hands are visibly shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at Margaret, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Praise Jesus?' That's fucking pushing it, Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell were those things?! You ever seen anything like that? You ever heard of anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret shakes her head.    Trevor looks at Starla, who also shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither. And I watch 'Animal Planet' all the fuckin' time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reception out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, I'll run out to your car, call for paramedics from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a long ways. Them worms are out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep my mouth covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll go. The three of you, you wait here. Get these folks, out of the barn. The stench and rot can't be any good for 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret and Trevor nod.    As Bill starts to leave, Star grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods. Makes a feeble attempt at a smile.   He jogs off into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs into the small glade, and looks around, trying to remember which way he came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes between some greenery, some distance away, and spies a long-lashed deer munching on foliage. A couple more deer and a fawn are eating as well. Bill looks at them a moment, peaceful, perhaps a sign of some hope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a parasite crawls up the deer's neck and slither into its mouth. Parasites crawl up the bodies and necks of the deer behind it. The deer buck and flounce and scratch trying to get the things off of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs away as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Margaret carry Jack out of the barn. He's bloated, corpse-like and covered in varicose veins. Margaret is wearing a gag-like swatch of clothing tied around her mouths, to protect themselves. Trevor's gag is down around his chin so he can chatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be some Goddamn biological weapons. Government's testin' 'em out on us! 'Cause who gives a shit if Wheelsy disappears, right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They set down Jack and head back toward the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it ain't contagious. I'll be pissed as hell I turn into a big mollusk. I'll fuckin' sue, I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, also wearing a gag, is kneeling beside Wally, who is similarly sick and bloated. His lips are parched and cracking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla squeezes a wet cloth, dripping all the water onto Wally's lips. Then she stands, and heads toward the creek

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't see Wally open his eyes behind her. He sits up, and stares over at Starla with milky eyes as she knee down beside the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla dips the swatch of clothing into the creek, re- wetting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, and turns, only to see Wally directly in fron of her, standing between trees, almost completely covered in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sugarplum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.   Starla pulls the gag from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally speaks with Grant's cadence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marriage. It's a sacred bond. Just like you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stares at him.   Wally almost looks weepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry 'bout trying to strangle you and all. I lost -- Lost my head. I didn't want to do none of the things I done. Not kill them pets. Not make Brenda a womb. But it's my nature, ain't it? How can you blame a one for actin' according to his nature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, too freaked to speak, takes a step back from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you what was going on. But I didn't - didn't think you'd love me no more. I never knew... love, Starla, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Margaret are setting down the Older Cop.   The see Wally standing. Margaret pulls down her gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally turns and stares at her like some angry animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better sit back down. You don't look so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor's staring at something. Margaret follows his eye line. Jack and the Older Cop are sitting up, staring at her, just like Wally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Redneck stumbles into the barn doorway, also staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is still alone in the Luv truck. The windows are clear; the parasites have abandoned their quest, just as they did with the posse in the barn. But Kylie stays in the car, trembling, afraid to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HEARS a DOOR OPEN. She sees her parents and her sisters come stumbling out the front door of her home. They're also bloated and diseased. Their chins and shirts are stained with the blood they spit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, honey, you okay? Come on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her family lumbers up to the truck. They peer in with their milky eyes. Her youngest sister pushes her face up close to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kylie.   It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her family tries the door handles, but they're locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, sweetie. I know we don't look so good, but your mommy and daddy love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Kylie, there's no excuse why not to be with your family. This is family fun day, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue RATTLING the door handles, over and over. They SLAP the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie SOBS.   Her sister speaks in a singsongy voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyyy-leee, this is your last cha- ance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her Dad leans over and picks up a large rock. He carries it toward the truck. He holds it up over the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie SCREAMS as he SMASHES it down. The windshield CRACKS, but doesn't shatter. He holds it up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, out of breath, runs out of the forest --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill emerges on the edge of the ranch, stretching five or six acres out in front of him. On the other side of the field is the gravel road, where his police car is parked. Beside the field is the Strutemyer's farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill HEARS a CRASH. He turns to see the diseased Strutemyers in their driveway, all holding rocks now, smashing the pickup's windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Strutemyers stop, mid-swing.   They turn toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie sees Bill through the rear windshield.    She unloc the door, and jumps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie runs past her family and up to Bill.    She grabs onto him, and hides behind him, WEEPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Dad's cadence is also like Grant's:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello there, Pardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you, Dwight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's Dad looks down at his own bloated arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison ivy out back, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're itchy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is obviously in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not my... They killed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Y'all just wait in this spot. I'm gonna call the paramedics for you. Kylie can come with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill turns to see the RANCHER with the cleft palate, now diseased, holding a shovel. He swings it into Bill, knocking him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie SCREAMS. Her family runs in toward them. She looks around to see a couple more DISEASED RANCHERS rushing toward them through the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cleft Palate Rancher stands over Bill and raises the shovel to bring it down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill feels for his shotgun, which has fallen into the dirt beside him. He yanks the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLAST hits the Rancher in the foot.    He buckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stands, pulling Kylie with him as the other diseased folks rush toward them through the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Kylie dash toward the cluster of cars as the diseased chase them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infected posse -- Wally, Jack, the Older Cop, and the Redneck recruit -- are all coming in towards Trevor and Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what'd I say?! Y'all just sit down! You need to get some Goddamn rest! You're sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla watches this, by herself, next to the creek. eyes a rifle in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs a fistful of Trevor's hair and restrains his arms. Wally pulls his pistols from their holsters and tosses them into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret goes to grab her pistol, when the Redneck opens his mouth wide and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLEEKS; that is, he sends a yellowish globby-stream shooting out of the back of his throat. The glob SPLASHES on Margaret's hand. Margaret SCREAMS, drops the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It burns!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret looks at her hand as the gleek-liquid sinks into her skin. The hand is swelling monstrously. It's soft. Parts of it are nearly dripping off the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do to my fuckin' hand?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack opens his mouth and GLEEKS too -- shooting the strea glob forward and onto her neck. Margaret SCREAMS again, grabbing onto her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret tries to speak, but she struggles just to breath as her neck puffs up, impeding her thorax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Older Cop buries his fingers into her neck. The puffy flesh comes off easily; it's soft, almost creamy. He stuffs the flesh into his mouth, eating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Margaret topples over, dying, the other posse members turn to look at a very freaked-out Trevor. The Redneck opens his mouth at him, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse turn and see Starla, who has made her way over to where the rifle was on the ground, and is now pointing the rifle at the posse, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, they release Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do to her?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stares at Starla.    He too speaks with Grant's cade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, sugarplum! Why you choosing camps 'fore you hear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK                            REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both sides of the story!?       Both sides of the story!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you talking like Grant?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse moves toward her. Starla is CRYING. The posse makes a COLLECTIVE SCREECHING sound, then speaks again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I am Grant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLY                           REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm you husband --              I'm you husband, Goddammi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You swore to honor and obey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLDER COP                       REDNECK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obey me --                      Obey me, so put that Godd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come any closer.    I'll... shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gonna shoot me! You always needed me to protect you! You for damn sure ain't got the balls to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla BLASTS Wally, blowing open a big crater into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally falls to his knees.    Starla and Trevor look on in shock, as they see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slithering parasite squirming out of the crater on his face -- out of the Wally's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little thing squirms down Wally's body and slithers off quickly into the woods. Wally falls over, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sick posse look at Starla, surprised, infuriated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then they leap at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla tries to shoot them.   But she's out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Trevor turn and dash away as quickly as their legs can take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Starla run in a zigzag pattern through trees rooted closely together, panicked, breathing heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit oh shit oh shit oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Kylie arrive at his police car. Bill throws the door open, and shoves Kylie inside. As he starts to get in, he turns to see the two little girls closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One opens her mouth and GLEEKS -- it shoots out and lands on the car right beside Bill's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other little girl opens her mouth to GLEEK as Bill jumps into the driver's seat. He slams the door shut just as the oozy liquid splashes on the window beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is grossed-out by this, but he doesn't have much time. He goes to reload his shotgun, when he remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   Ammo's in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor!   Margaret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor turns and sees Jack, the Redneck, and the Older Cop leap powerfully over the brush behind them, coming in fast. But he's able to grab onto his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed Margaret!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie's two sisters jump onto the hood, SCREECHING.   The SLAM rocks on the windshield. Kylie SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming your way, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill JAMS the car forward, knocking the sisters off the hood. Then he slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back and sees the two little girls running towar the car again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he sees the mass of diseased ranch families also running toward the car. Kylie is SCREAMING and CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!   Go!   Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, instead, of pulling forward on the gravel road, Bill turns up and onto the ranch itself -- back towards the running diseased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends are still in the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill speeds the police car over the dirt field, trying to avoid approaching ranchers. Some leap at the car, holding on and getting tossed aside. Bill zooms back toward the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Bill gets a little headway on the diseased, the car gets stuck in some mud. The wheels spin, spraying mud, as the infected approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks back to see Jack right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infected arrive at the car. Bill just lets his foot off the gas, and sits there, letting the ranchers leap onto the car. Kylie looks at Bill, panicked by his choice to do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need their weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill slams down the gas again, and the car zooms forward. The diseased get knocked off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbshits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill rushes toward the trees of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla keeps running, when she trips and falls. She looks down to see she stumbled over old barbed wire fencing, now long fallen and curling on the forest floor. Starla forces herself up, as Jack closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack grabs onto her blouse, SCREECHING furiously.   When he HEARS something and looks over to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's police car, cruising over the forest floor, direct toward him. Jack, frightened, lets go of Starla. He's about to get hit when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car suddenly stops, jammed between two trees, inches from Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack smiles, and moves toward Bill -- but Starla rises behind him, holding a sharp rusty stake from the barbed- wire fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thrusts it forward, hard; and it pops out the front of Jack's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to look at Starla, and topples over into the leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill backs the car out from between the trees. He sees the Older Cop and Redneck coming in toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor and Starla get into the car.   The Older Cop watch them back away and yells:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car pulls up and out of the forest. The car is in bad shape. Steam rises from the smashed grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks to his side; he's down a bit from the Strutemyers' ranch. He pulls away, heading back toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome sit in a stupefied daze. Starla's beside Bill. Trevor and Kylie are in the back. Bill grabs the police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. STATIC.   Everyone notes this, worried.    Bill tries again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, there's nothing.    And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Chief.   How y'all doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Starla look at each other, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby sits at the police operator's unit, peppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dig that rat out of the hole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you got any reports of... I don't know what you call 'em. They look like big slugs, only fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slugs? No. 'Less you talkin' about that new waitress down at Sloan's! Ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! I hope she ain't a police radio aficionado. If so, I apolog -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, shut up. Keep an eye out for these things. If you see 'em, keep your mouth covered. Otherwise they'll go straight down it. All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby looks confused, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nodding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear when you're nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be there in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hangs up. Kylie is clutching onto herself, hollow- eyed, in deep shock. She mutters, almost unintelligibly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worms are in their brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, Bill, and Trevor look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA TRACKS QUICKLY FORWARD, through the forest, and to a CLOSEUP on the Redneck, who is hunched over Margaret's body, eating her flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO a CAT SCAN of the REDNECK'S HEAD: a parasite is imbedded into his brain; its tail hangs down his spine wagging just a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drivin' 'em around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stares at Kylie like she's insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. We saw one -- one came out of Wally's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sort of his eye, it came out there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, how do you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie is rocking back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, how do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie shakes her head.    She doesn't want to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, honey.    Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of bad things have happened to you today, we know. But we need your help to find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie CRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the bath. It tried to go inside me and I -- for a minute I became it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? (pause) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Grant's husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not always. I was -- He was... other stuff too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie kind of points at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fucking Martian?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Martian is from Mars, Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie tries to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real it looks like a needle. Its real face. But it always gots another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes from place to place, worlds... planets... killing 'em. He takes over half of what's alive and eats the other half. Till they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her, freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he's here.     He went in Mr. Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a wound on his stomach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took him over. His body. His -- his brain, everything what he knew. He's only been dumb stuff before - amoeba-things, and rhino-things. He liked being human. Didn't want to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you said the worms are part of him. They're all linked, like one creature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When one sees you they all see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An animal that doesn't procreate. It spreads, grows. A living disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kylie) So the way to stop this thing is to stop Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie shrugs.   The police car starts CHUGGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car slows, and comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Starla, Kylie, and Trevor step slowly out of the car. They look around the deserted road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wide-open night is shrouded in darkness. Quiet. They can see the lights of Wheelsy down the road in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill speaks into the radio again, as he gets his leather satchel of weaponry out of the trunk. Trevor grabs ammo from the satchel to reload his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, we broke down on 22, a mile outside town. Come pick us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to leave my post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome walks down the road, toward the city.   Star and Bill are in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Starla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was always curious why you... married Grant in the first place... Just never seemed outta love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what people say, Bill. I... Remember, back in high school I worked at my father's gas station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant used to get filled up every day. I knew it was just to see me. He was too old -- But he was handsome. And he had that big ol' Lincoln then. I flirted with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, big ol' Lincoln, sure. Guess I would have flirted with him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla smiles, thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father, he was -- he was real close to evil. People didn't know. Still don't. From the time I was a toddler he'd beat the hell out of me. I don't mean just like a smack for smart-mouthing... he took a real enjoyment in it. And when I turned eleven or twelve, things... well, they got worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at Bill, who seems struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you wanted to run away, I called your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't a good night, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Grant rolls in one day. I fill his tank with like an eighth- a-gallon as usual. And he notices my lip's all swollen up, and starts asking me how it happened. I don't know why I chose then, why Grant -- I guess I saw an opportunity. And I told him everything, first time I told anyone. Grant was furious. He picked up a tire iron, walked straightaway into the garage, and beat my father half to death. You say it's not about love, Bill. But that was the closest thing to it I ever knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant asked me to marry him a few weeks later. I felt... safe with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill nods.    Starla looks at him, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all this shit tonight, I know for sure now you regret not running off with me to Hollywood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, Starla.    I always regretted that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks at him, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks at Kylie, shivering and terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, kid. Pretty soon, we'll be in town, everything'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slithering parasite squirms over a paint-chipped sign that reads "WELCOME TO WHEELSY, SOUTH CAROLINA, THE WHEEL OF THE FUTURE," featuring early-'sixties graphics of a utopian future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES DOWN to the road, where hundreds of slithering parasites squirm into the city. They divide off in thin lines heading toward the various homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE UP TO a WINDOW on a SMALL HOUSE, through which we can see an OVERWEIGHT WOMAN in spasms with a slithering thing in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN TO the WINDOW of the HOME NEXT DOOR, where we can see a FAMILY gathered around a CORPSE, feasting on his goopy flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our foursome look up to see a Buick Century parked at a haphazard angle in the middle of the road. The driver's side door is open. The headlights are still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Bill takes his flashlight off his belt and aims it in front of him. They all slowly approach the car, in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill aims his flashlight into the Buick.   The keys are still there, but no one's inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks at the grill of the car.   It's dented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They musta hit a deer. Probably got out to see if it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and the others look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hears a LAPPING sound behind him.   He turns, aiming the flashlight downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISEASED DEER is lapping a thick purple tongue on the wound of a dead man. The sick creature is mostly hairless and pink and covered in veins. Bulbous black eyes hang on the sides of its head like a goldfish's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased deer glances up at Bill and GROWLS a low growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deer springs upward, bringing his hoofs into Bill's chest. Bill is knocked violently to the gravel, dropping his shotgun and satchel. The deer rears back and brings his hoofs down into Bill again. They CRACK Bill's head against the hard road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, Trevor, and Starla see diseased deer coming in at them from different directions. The deer SCREECH like dying rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bambi-rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor aims his pistol at a DEER jumping toward him. He SHOOTS, misses. The deer knocks him down. The deer stomps his feet, rearing up and down on Trevor's ribs, almost like a little dance. The deer tears at Trevor's sleeve with decidedly carnivorous teeth, forcing him into lettin go of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie SCREAMS. She dives into a small space beneath a rock overhang on the side of the road. She watches what's going on from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla sees the Buick a few yards away. She glances besid her to see the largest diseased deer of all, a HORNED BUCK, careening toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dashes toward the Buick as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TUMOROUS DOE leaps onto Bill, biting into his shoulder and tearing at his flesh, so now he has two deer on him. Bill is bleeding, dizzy, and disoriented, but he's able to turn, just a bit, to see the barrel of his shotgun above him. He tries to scoot himself back as he's being battered. He reaches up for the shotgun; but the tips of his fingers barely graze the muzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla arrives at the Buick, and starts to crawl into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the horned buck is upon her.   He bites into Starla's ankle. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks back on her, half pulling her onto the road. But Starla grabs onto the steering wheel with all her might, and pulls against the horned buck's massive power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deer on Trevor starts pulling him off, dragging him down the road as he HOLLERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie, underneath the rock overhang, watches Bill try to scoot himself back and reach for the shotgun. It's just a little too far away. She works up her nerve and slowly starts to crawl out toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Starla is stretched between the horned buck pulling on her ankle, and her hand on the steering wheel, she's able to flip on her side and turn the keys in the ignition; the ENGINE STARTS. She reaches one hand down to the floorboard, pressing on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Buick lurches forward, wrenching her away from the horned buck's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill reaches again for the barrel of his rifle. It's too far away. But then he sees Kylie, at the butt of the rifle. She reaches out and pushes it just a little, into Bill's hand. Bill grips the muzzle like a baseball bat, and swings it into the face of the deer jumping on him, knocking the beast back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deer tries to stumble forward again, but its whole head and neck have been knocked askew. It topples over, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill flips the shotgun forward into his hands. He stuffs the muzzle into the tumorous doe biting into his leg. The deer looks at him. Blood is running down Bill's face and he looks half-crazed. Bill glances down and sees the telephone wire wrapped around her ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pulls the trigger, destroying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands, looking around for the deer with Trevor. It has dragged him a fair distance down the street. Bill SHOOTS once, missing it, and again, hitting it straight on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie looks around to see more diseased deer running through the fields toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla pulls herself into the driver's seat and backs up alongside her friends. Throws open the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill fumbles for the radio controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor looks out the window, watching the deer fade away behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I buy my zoo, I'm leaving them things the hell out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby! We need people out here at Cosgrove and McCammon right away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelby, sick and bloated, speaks into his radio, as he moves down the street with a hoard of the infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kylie turns her head, and glances out the window.   And SCREAMS. Starla, Bill, and Trevor turn to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An SUV barreling straight towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It SLAMS hard into the side of the Buick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And SMASHES the car back, across a short lot, and through the glass storefront of a flower store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Buick and SUV are destroyed, amidst the ruins of this store. Shattered vases and flowers surround them. Glass fragments dangle from the window frame. Some fall and CLINK to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla lifts her battered head from the wheel. She looks beside her to see Bill and Trevor, seemingly unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Kylie. The impact has killed her. Her neck is bent at an ungodly angle. Bone juts up out of her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks out her rear window and sees the SUV door open, and the DISEASED DRIVER stumble out. His body is battered and broken, but, still, he lumbers toward her. He tries to speak, but his jaw is broken, and only a MUMB MOAN comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla struggles to get out of the car. Eventually, she does, and she falls to the floor, amidst the broken glass from the shattered window, and the water all over the floor from the broken vases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the moaning driver limping toward her.   He's still trying to speak, but he's unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver gets close, ready to grab her. Starla sees a metal bar. She grabs it. And SLAMS it into the diseased man's shin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He topples over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls onto the fallen driver and brings the metal bar down into his head, again and again, SHOUTING and CRYING with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks down at the man, who is very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks up to see dozens of DISEASED TOWNSFOLK comin at her, from down the street, between buildings. They see Starla there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starrrrrlaaaaaa!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Trevor limp up behind Starla, pulling her toward a door on the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill closes and locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk surround the little store on all sides. They SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are we going to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just block the doors, any way you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grabs hammers and nails off a hardware bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor knocks things off shelves and yanks up the metal shelving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks doubtful of this whole activity.   But still she helps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storeroom has two doors.    They start nailing anythi over them they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor sees some slithering parasites coming in through a crack in the upper corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn snakes!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor aims his pistol at the things and starts shooting wildly at them, BLASTING up the whole room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Starla see slithering parasites coming in from other cracks in the room as well. They also BLAST at them. Dust is all around; they can hardly see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs out of ammo. He grabs a hand-held Black and Decker electric circular saw and turns it on. He starts jamming it into the parasites, cutting them up, and putti big slices in the floor. They SQUEAK with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk WAIL and SLAP their hands on the walls, almost rhythmically, like some tribal ritual. Some push on the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hears something POP behind him. He turns to see a little hole in one of the doors. Three diseased fingers slip inside, trying to pull away more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill uses the circular saw to cut off the fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arm pops through the door.    Bill slams the circular saw into that. Blood spurts.     Bone grinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's eye peeks through another crack. Bill jams the circular saw through the crack and into the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FACE-SAWED MAN backs away from the hole, clutching his bleeding eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill spots a wide piece of shelving falling off the door across from him. He runs over to the space, when the circular saw stops turning. Bill turns to see he's accidentally unplugged it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk have all gathered on one side of the building now, putting all their efforts into tearing down one door. Some have even climbed onto the roof above it, curling off the gutter and roofing overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grabs his leather satchel, and starts to reload his shotgun. Starla sees that the diseased townsfolk have almost torn down one of the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla goes to the other door, and starts tearing away the planks they nailed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't make it. Just get away, when you get the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me, Bill! I'm going to get him to take me to him! See if you can follow me, and kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Starla!   No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another full metal plate is pushed off the door. A DISEASED MAN'S face peeks through. Trevor swirls to see it. The Man GLEEKS, hitting Trevor on his chest. Trevor looks down, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the whole door and part of the wall bursts open. The Diseased pour inside and around Trevor, GLEEKING all over him, splattering his body with the burning liquid. Trevor starts to puff up, swelling, becoming soft. They grab him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grabs Trevor by the wrist, and tries to pull him away from them. But Trevor SCREAMS in agony; the liquid has made his flesh too soft. His entire body splits apart like wet tissue, his organs spilling out in front of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill stares down in shock, still holding Trevor's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla has pulled away enough boards of the other door. She throws it open. None of the diseased are on this side of the building anymore. She moves outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill follows her. Two DISEASED PEOPLE appear, SCREECHING and running toward them. Bill SHOOTS them both. And he makes a break for it, running as fast as he can across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, expecting to see Starla right behind him. But she has stayed behind, staring quietly at the ground. Starla has tears in her eyes. She motions with her head for Bill to go. Bill is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk come up around Starla from the sides of the flower store, no one paying attention to Bill. They encircle her, slowly. Some SCREECH angrily at her. She's too disgusted or fearful to even look in their eyes. They BREATHE with SICK, RASPY breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISEASED WOMAN                 DISEASED KID
