dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starlaaaaaaa!                  Starlaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they WAIL, in a cacophony of simultaneous voices, all the deep angers, fears, frustrations, and jealousies they inherited from Grant Grant, such as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said for better or worse! You lied!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO LONGER PRETTY                BRENDA'S HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you everything!         I.   Loved. You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHELBY                           FAT SICK GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just about lesson       I wanted you by my side, plans! Hank Wilcox wants         sugarplum. But I'm too your pussy!                      ugly now, huh!!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. INAPPROPRIATE                WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy'd still be            You always thought I was fucking your every hole          joke, ain't you? weren't it for me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Pardy better'n me? That's who you want to screw now?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant... Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They surround her. They touch her body, her ass, her breasts. Pull on her clothes. She trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I know I haven't behaved how you -- how you want. I know. Don't... hurt... me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla glances down to see a diseased dog licking her calf, tasting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need... to... talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISEASED MAN grabs the side of her neck and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISEASED MAN                     BRENDA'S HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then talk.                       Then talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here, though, okay? Not all of you. I'm not used to -- I want to talk to your face, Grant. Your more real face. Your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk grab Starla, enveloping her, and start dragging her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few townsfolk remain behind.    They look around for Bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardy?!!   Where are you, Pardy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's nowhere to be seen.    They SCREECH angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs as fast as he can across the street here -- the same direction the hoard took Starla, but down a block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill falls against the side of this building, hiding in a dark crevice. Down the way, he can see numerous dead bodies, and a WOMAN chased down and tackled by some infected townsfolk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some diseased townsfolk wander by Bill, looking for him. Bill crouches down so he isn't seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISEASED WOMAN               SHELBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardy.   Pardy. Pardy.        Come on out, Pardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've surrounded the town, you prick! Ain't no way outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill waits for them to pass. When they're gone, Bill looks up toward the next street -- he can see the hoard moving Starla across that street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes sure no one's looking, and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the diseased pushes Starla too hard, and she falls to her hands and knees. They keep pushing her. She stumbles back to her feet and moves on. She's almost hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, the Diseased Townsfolk around Starla stop. She looks up to see that they've led her onto her own front yard. Starla gazes up at her home:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased have done a little remodeling. Part of the front wall has been torn away, replaced with some primiti thatched woodwork. The front doorway has also been partially destroyed. Because of the sloppy reconstruction the roof is caved-in and sloping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diseased people sit in meerkat-like poses on all sides of the Grants' home, watching out for trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, out of breath, arrives across the street. He can see Starla standing with the diseased. He hides behind some shrubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased push Starla up between them, violently, to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stops at the dark hole on the front of the house. It's pitch black inside. She looks back at the rotting faces behind her. And then slowly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla balks at the smell. She looks beside her at the garage; the wall has been torn out, and this has become Grant's feeding area, with rotten meat, including some bodies, in a pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla steps slowly forward, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla can see into the shambles of a kitchen from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill looks at the diseased surrounding the Grant home. They seem impossible to get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill eyes the house next door, maybe twenty-five feet from the Grants'. He makes sure no one's paying attention for a moment, and he darts across the street to a parked car. The diseased don't see him. Bill gazes down the street beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is just barely beginning to rise.   They don't have much time to move in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill makes a break for the house next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla walks into the kitchen. Cooking supplies and condiments are scattered over the floor. She spots a meat thermometer on the floor amongst other utensils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances out the rear window. Diseased people are guarding the backyard, looking away from the home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the meat thermometer. She snaps the thermometer part off the top, discards it, and shoves the long metal spike into the seam of her skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Starla hears EVERY WOMAN IN THE WORLD, the song she and Grant danced to earlier, starting to play through tinny speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks up through a missing section of ceiling; she can see a tiny piece of Grant in the bedroom above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?   We should talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill has made his way into the backyard. He looks over at the Grant home. Some diseased townsfolk in the backyar could conceivably see or hear him. He tries the back door, but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill notices a window slightly open.    He starts to push it up. It SQUEAKS LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers over at the diseased. They don't hear. He throws the window up further, and crawls inside the home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stands at the base of the stairwell.    The SONG i louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to ascend the stairs.     They CREAK beneath h feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill peeks out the window, careful not to be seen by the diseased humans around Grant's. Bill can see Starla in the home next door, walking up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill runs toward the stairwell here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks down the hall.    Most of the walls have bee torn away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between wooden beams, Starla can see Grant's cumbersome mass, his back to her, in what was once the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of him, the SONG ENDS on the CD player. It start into the NEXT SONG on the album. Grant uses one of his crusty tentacles to push the back button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERY WOMAN IN THE WORLD starts over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant keeps his back to her. Starla takes in the room. Photographs from their scrapbooks are all over the walls: photos from their wedding, and vacations, and family parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla walks around Grant, giving him a decent berth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did some real interesting decorating here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant watches her from the corner of his sad, purulent eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla walks by a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the sun's starting to come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla starts to open the drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill happens to look through the neighbors' kid's bedroom and to the home across the way where Starla is pulling the drapes away from the window. She sees Bill there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant SCREECHES angrily at Starla. She quickly closes the drapes, not letting on she saw Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I didn't -- I didn't know you wanted it dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill walks into this young boy's bedroom, filled with airplanes and sports memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peeks around the window frame at the Grant bedroom window, now closed to him. He makes sure his shotgun is loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla tries to change the subject by walking to a wall with the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like these memories, huh, Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks away from her.   Starla moves toward him, alm seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like being called Grant, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is silent.   She gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do. You really do. You like being Grant. Like when we danced. And when you... made love to me here on the bed. Remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks embarrassed.   Starla becomes more brazen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been alone, Grant. Almost forever. From here to there to there to here, there's never been another one for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla almost looks as if she's about to cry, out of compassion for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant. Grant, I could help you. Be with you the way you want. See, I want to live. I've never had much use for this world, not really. You and I, together, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his tentacle with her fingers.   He moves it back, and GROWLS a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla moves her trembling fingers toward him again. She sets them on his tentacle once more. He glares at her distrustfully, breathing his deep, sick breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me, I know. That's why I brought you someone, Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bill. He's in the house next door. Just look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill glances down to see a diseased man looking up at him. In fact, they're all looking up at him. Bill is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant looks at Starla with sad eyes, perhaps touched. Starla smiles nervously, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I brought him here for you! As an offering! To prove I love you more than him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant wraps his tentacle around Starla. Starla, though obviously disgusted, touches his face with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk break down the door, moving into the downstairs below Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hears them approaching. He SHATTERS the window, and crawls onto a small mock-balcony outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla moves slowly in toward Grant, as if to kiss him. Grant looks, well, joyful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she yanks the metal spike from her skirt and JABS it into Grant's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant SCREECHES, blind and bucking.   Starla SLAMS the spike into his other eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she STABS him again, shoving the spike into his forehead, where it stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla leaps to the window.   She throws open the drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Bill!!   Kill the motherfucker!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill raises his shotgun and BLASTS as Starla jumps away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WINDOW SHATTERS and the shot strikes Grant. He SCREECHES, swinging his tentacles aimlessly around the room in fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One tentacle SLAMS Starla against the wall, probably breaking a rib or two. Another tentacle SMASHES the CD player, squelching the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk enter the kid's bedroom, rushing toward Bill on the balcony. But Bill won't stop. He BLASTS the shotgun again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is struck in the head. He starts slithering out of the bedroom, feeling his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill is out of shells. He drops his shotgun. He grabs the grenade out of the pocket on the black leather bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, clutching her ribs and barely able to move, pulls herself up on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill tosses her the grenade. She tries to catch it, but misses it. It lands on the carpet. She see Grant's tentacles slipping away. She tries to move but she's hurt bad, bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased GLEEK at Bill, but Bill throws himself forward, letting himself fall through the flimsy balustra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill lands hard on the lawn between the two homes. He grabs a .38, and stands beside the window on Grant's hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window he sees Grant barreling down the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill SHOOTS Grant with the .38, SHATTERING the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He UNLOADS the clip into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diseased townsfolk surround Bill, grabbing him. Grant using the others' eyes to see, snaps his tentacle forward wrapping it around Bill's neck, raising him up. Grant SCREECHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla appears at the top of the stairs, clutching her bloody side. She has the pin in one hand and the grenade in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all her remaining effort, she lobs the grenade behin Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant's exploding flesh sends Bill flying backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla is thrown back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the house, the diseased's eyes gaze lifelessly upward as they each plummet to the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill unwraps what's left of the tentacle from his bruised neck, and looks around at the dead diseased. Grant's splattered flesh is around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill hears a quiet RATTLING sound. He looks around him. And then sees, down at his feet, what is actually a distorted piece of Grant's cerebellum. Sticking out of a new organic slit in the cerebellum is the quill-like spor It quivers and trembles upward, its little bulbed spurs popping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla crawls forward to look down through the smoke: most of the second floor has been blown away. Her mutated husband is just a mass of flesh and alien organs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla comes around the side of the house, holding a pape towel roll to the slice on her ribs. She sees Bill standing there. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill smiles too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Starla hobble down the town center. The leather bag is slung over Bill's shoulder. Everything around them is dead: the victims who were being feasted on, as well as the various diseased. The torture is over, but no life remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill finds an abandoned Nissan Maxima in the middle of the street, with the keys still in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla, over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Maxima now, Bill and Starla pull around a toppled ambulance and through a spouting fire hydrant, and out onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is bright and beautiful, glistening on the car. Bill and Starla breathe more easily and smile a little as they head up this long, barren road outside the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Starla pass through a small block of stores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla gazes out the window to see people -- real, actual HEALTHY HUMAN BEINGS: men and women and children -- going about their daily chores. Tears come to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill grabs Starla's hand.   She clenches his tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can probably get some first aid and food at this gas station up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maxima pulls into the station, and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla and Bill pile stuff up on the cashier's counter -- Band-Aids, gauze, alcohol; Power Bars and Gatorade. The CASHIER rings it up, staring at them because of their wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes to 32.87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pulls money out of his pants pocket. As he does, Starla glances down. His arm pulls up his shirt, and Starla can see the black and yellow wound there on his stomach. She turns away, looking around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pays, smiles at the cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned Starla steps with Bill out of the station, movi toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I- I forgot... I wanted to get aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to move back inside.     Bill stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it for you.      Ibuprofen or aspirin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill smiles, and goes back inside. Starla moves quickly with the bag of stuff toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill pays for the aspirin, and walks out with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill walks out; the Maxima is still there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill gets in the driver's seat, puts his keys into the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just head up here into Bishopville, get checked up in the hospital. Then maybe we'll head off to Hollywood after all, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill turns to smile at Starla. She's aiming the .38 at his face. Tears are streaming down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Starla. I'm gonna do my best not to hurt anybody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla pulls the trigger, the GUNSHOT CRACKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Maxima sits in the lot, ANOTHER GUNSHOT CRACKS OUT. Then we hear the HORN BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's dead body is slumped over the steering wheel. Starla really can't bring herself to look at it, as she reaches across it and toward the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car door flips open.    The horn stops blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bill's body is kicked out of the car, sliding onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLiTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla WIPES the tears away from her face. She glances out the window to see the cashier peeking out of the cashier's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla scoots over into the driver's seat.    She shoves the car into drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she takes off down the road, not looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starla's blanched and numb but the tears still keep comin
